name: overmedicated
text: A comment left by overmedicated was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by _cheesekayke, Soilentshuggah, amandulence)

name: chaesar
text: A comment left by chaesar was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by envika, kenthegod, tttt2, _cheesekayke)

name: goriasxy
text: I would definitely buy a panel 3 t-shirt.

name: greyfield
text: Toilet party is one of those moments that falls by the wayside in comparison with the greatness that is TGOF, Cartilage Head, Ray in Hell, etc., but it has a wonderful appeal. You know you always feel a bit better after discovering a clean toilet.

name: utv
text:
No way man. My "Ray Gets Sort of Stoned" reminds me every day of the greatness of this arc.

Shank 'em if you got 'em, fellas!

name: davidbs
text: The only thing that separates the sublime from the mundane is approval and interest from friends.

name: saint
text: what about deep, personal meaning?

name: spinynorman
text: FUCK that shit!

name: atticusonline
text:
bbcode to the rescue!
bbcode to the rescue!

name: soticoto
text:
Aye... I'm inclined to agree.

A thing can be truly sublime... and then "friends" come along and ruin it by making it "popular", and hence it becomes mundane.
If we want the good stuff, we have to keep it to ourselves.

name: petitegitan
text: It is nice to know when the small things make a big difference.

name: tourach3
text: A comment left by tourach3 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sean1058, dasilodavi, peterjoel)

name: ebessan
text: Indeed that's what she said. Because she said it.

name: n0umena
text: Because her boyfriend has a tiny penis?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: more like that's what i told her the next morning.

name: sargasm
text: I wish I had the stones to host a Toilet Party.  It probably wouldn't work because my friends wouldn't get it, and because I wouldn't be able to get the Tenmen, but mostly because of the first reason.

name: hellofyellin
text: Everyone start using "Hooray, man!" in your daily lives. It feels really good.

name: deancain29
text: ok.

name: woof
text: alt text: Don't let them fool ya, or even try to school ya! Oh, no!

name: waddlerz
text: It sounds like Onstad pulled that from the song 'take it from the man' by the Brian Jonestown Massacre

name: heyman
text: I have to say, Straight up fuck the Brian Johnstown Massacre

name: waddlerz
text: First off, it's Jonestown, second off, i was merely stating a point, and third off, why?

name: heyman
text: Okay, blatent fuck up with the name, my bad.  I saw them in concert and they were being such assholes (the lead singer mostly) that they almost got booed off the stage.  Any band that stops a song four separate times in a live gig to individually tune their guitars while telling the whole audience to "SHUT THE FUCK UP" is pretty worthy of my contempt

name: rowboat
text: And they ain't good, too.

name: waddlerz
text: Yeah, Anton is kind of a prick, i see your point, but they have some decent music aside from their antics

name: tekende
text: If you had capitalized "antics" I would totally have chubbied you despite the fact that I don't know enough about the Brian Jonestown Massacre to agree or disagree with you.

name: waddlerz
text: Also, I forgot to mention this 6 months ago, but your avatar totally makes this comment, hence why I chubby it now, despite the insult

name: sharpdresseddan
text: Actually, its from "Could you be loved" one of the best Bob Marley songs ever

name: odei
text: If a friend said to me "You want to go on a little mini-vacation to paradise? Come look in my toilet, dude!" I would most likely decline his offer.

name: zem
text: yeah, but if ray said it?

name: odei
text: How could I not? I mean most of the achewood cast are used to his antics, but they usually go along to see what simple pleasures he delights in.

name: aparrish
text: And hey, if it doesn't work out? "Damn, odei didn't much like what was in my toilet. We lookin' at a six hundo." You come out ahead of the game.

name: crinklebat
text: I wish this were in color. But I guess that would spoil it.

name: pitseleh
text: Now all they need is Philippe. "I'm the toilet!"

name: honesttom
text: Isn't there a special website where you can watch women doing something similar?

name: redsalesperson
text: Not only that, they'll also eat sandwiches.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ...for a fee.

name: sp1derbaby
text: So the toilet thing is free but there's a fee for watching them eat sandwiches? Damn! If only it were the other way around...

name: deathpiano
text: In my head, Ray speaks the first panel like Will Farrell from Anchorman. A bit of a cadence to it, not yawning but just saying the words and getting the same pleasure .

name: atticusonline
text: how to drink scotch: The scotchy scotch way

name: fermatprime
text: The first panel is hell of underrated. Everyone remembers 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, but "Yawn yawn yawny-yawn!" is wonderful.

name: _cheesekayke
text: Toilet cleaner is indeed the most beautiful shade of blue that there can be.

name: nighttoad
text:
totally. this strip brings back memories of me as a little girl using my grandmother's toilet. she always used 2000 flushes. that shade of blue was probably my favorite color.

wait... is that weird?

name: all-star951
text:
I always thought it meant he flushed the toilet 2000 times.
I stand corrected.

name: spinynorman
text: It makes Easter or Egshell Blue look like canned dogfood swallowed, half-digested, and then barfed onto a pile of burning hair

name: ttagxamm
text:
By the rivers of Babylon
where we sat down...

[not actually Bob Marley, no matter what the internet tells you, but seemed appropriate]

name: johnnylandmine
text:
This is a really great party until some jerk has to actually use the toilet and everything is ruined.

My money's on Lyle.

name: tekende
text: No, no, then the water turns green and it is awesome!

name: dropkickpikachu
text: For fucking real, man. It teaches you about color mixing! Clean and educational!

name: greenkoolayd
text: apparently thats a good game to potty train kids.  use 2000 flushes, so they can feel all proud and magical when they turn the blue water green with their pee.

name: sp1derbaby
text:
...or else Lyle adds a desert island to Paradise.

Or an archipelago. Lyle drinks a lot.

name: brzbee
text: I love this whole arc. While not as epic as the Great Outdoor Fight, i feel it delivers more individually funny strips than any other arc.

name: riazm
text:
The amount of time between the penultimate and final panels is actually considerate as Ray attempts to convince Beef that this isn't some low shennanigan.

Things ain't ever the same once you seen a dude's stew.

name: riazm
text: I meant to say considerable..of course.

name: hendetta
text: Hooray, man!

name: hendetta
text: It is the little things that count.

name: tragicone
text: Mr. Smuckles can put on a party at the drop of a hat.

name: tragicone
text: Also... Grammer error in panel 5? Check out this. More like, "Check this out!"

name: salo
text: Oh hey what it is?

name: hellofditties
text: Check out this ?

name: edwell
text:
Oh my yes that is hell of such as improper

Dang dogg however did you catch that

Cold browsin' Achewood all waitin' for a notion of language to be bent

name: tragicone
text: how could people ignore it is a better question.

name: i_love_kate
text: Ray is opting not to end his sentence with a preposition. We should honour his valiant effort.

name: aliiis
text:
grammer = error

It is spelled GRAMMAR.

name: atticusonline
text:
-=ERROR ERROR=-

oh dang, that's how ray cold signs his name

name: sp1derbaby
text: Ah but in fairness, that was an error in spelling rather than grammar.

name: tragicone
text: Right, I've never claimed I was the champ of the spelling bee.

name: deusoma
text: I got a friend interested in Achewood by sending him the last two panels completely out of context.

name: direhaggis
text: And on the 11th day of the 1st month, the scene was set for the toilet bowl party. Check out this!

name: meetzorp
text: I SO love this story arc!  I recommend this to anyone I think will enjoy Achewood because it is such a good nutshell of who the characters are and what they're about.

name: edwell
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: latterman
text: This would have an excessive amount of chubbies if more people bothered to read older strips.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
it'll get there.

just wait for it.

name: goatmasterflash
text: I had a real bug quite similar to your avatar crawling around on my computer screen, and prior to figuring out it was an animated .gif, my inability to smash your bug was making me retarded.

name: kickstart
text: [i]Volume Bloo[i] sells it

name: erinye
text: Never gets less funny. I approve.

name: atticusonline
text: damn...the spawning of a great arc...damn

name: madrin
text:
i think this is one of my top 3 favourite strips.
If there was a world where gold and platinum could have sex, and then in x months ( x = however long it takes for something to gestate in platinum) something was born, it would be this strip.

name: the_leif
text: I totally feel where this strip is coming from. That color is like a little slice of awesome. Damn.

name: poodlelucy
text: i can attest to the state of bliss blue toilet water can induce. testify!

name: coldfrog
text: I woke up this morning, pretended to write some code, popped open Achewood and hit the random comic button.  I arrived here with a smile on my face and a feeling that, at least for the next 30 minutes, today would be a good day.  It is an omen!

name: tekende
text: I could have sworn that panel three used to say "Hooray, man! Today is already rad!" but now it does not. Can anyone confirm this?

name: zapatos
text: What a great day!

name: ge7243
text: I'm confident I've been just as pleased with deep-blue toilet water. I'm not sure why I don't clean my toilet more often.

name: carlyle
text: I'm not too sure what to make of this.

name: darkkarma42
text: Strips like this make me wish I was an Achewood cat.

name: carlyle
text: Sometimes the only way I can get up is if I do what Ray does in the first panel.

name: dcofosho224
text: There is a restaurant in Patterson NY called "Texas Taco". the restaurant itself is in a dilapidated old house and looks like going to a Carny garage sale on Ayahuasca and the bathroom is a tropical undersea adventure (this is why it came to mind). im not even exaggerating (in fact im doing the opposite words fail to describe such a place). seek this place out and go there. the tostadas were mediocre and they dont put paper umbrellas in any of their drinks but daaaayum that place crazy.
